page.title: 11POLICING SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: The area is covered by two differing types of policing. The north and east are covered by foot and vehicle patrols from a central police station twenty-four hours a day. The rest of the area has two "community policemen" who provide cover for up to sixteen hours a day. When they are not working police cover is by way of vehicle patrols from the central police station. "Community policemen" walk the same area all the time while the police from the main station work a different area every few days.
